results.title: Popular psychology
results.creator_credit: Julia Murphy, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: How much faith should one put in popular psychology? When psychological theories are all around, how is the lay person to keep proper perspectives? The film centers the question around two women, Barbara and Jane. Barbara is regarded by Jane as indulging in the psychology fad, looking for problems in her husband and child to practise her do-it-yourself analysis. But, wonders Jane, is a little psychology better than none at all? The question is left open for discussion.

results.title: Pop and Op Art
results.brief_description: A two part look at the development of Pop Art in both the United States and in Europe. The first program traces the work of major Pop artists such as Roy Lichtenstein, Andy Warhol, George Segal and Robert Rauschenberg with a discussion of the subjects, styles and themes common to Pop Art and its manifestations in painting, photography, three dimensional installations and staged “happenings”. The boundary between commercial art and Pop Art is also discussed with particular reference to the intentions behind the work where familiar objects are placed out of context, though not necessarily for the purposes of social comment. The second part details European Pop Art and the stronger critique engaged in both in reference to American art and the political contexts within which they were produced. Artists such as Christo and Marciel Raysse are discussed in detail, with attention to their aims of creating a new synthetic reality to evoke impermanence and disorder and neutralise and deglamourise commercial, mechanical and iconic imagery. This second program also looks at Optical art, detailing its focus on geometrical patterns, flat colours and optical illusions, both in terms of its history and in terms of the work of modern artists such as Joseph Albers and Bridgette Riley.

results.title: Poor man's orange (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Whaley, Anthony Buckley, Anthony Buckley Productions and Quantum Films
results.brief_description: Television dramatisation of the second of Ruth Park’s novels covering the trials and tribulations of the poor Irish-Australian Darcy family of number 12 1/2 Plymouth Street in Surrey Hills - a Sydney slum. In this series it is the 1950’s and all the Darcy children have grown up yet they still have to face the problems of their working class background.

results.title: Pond zero
results.creator_credit: Dietmar Fill, Don Harley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A microscopic look at life in a salt water pond located in South Australia providing a unique insight with the use of infra-red light and underwater time-lapse cameras.

results.title: Polyester
results.creator_credit: John Waters and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: A comedy melodrama of the tragic life of Francine Fishpaw (Divine) an obese housewife whose mere existence burdens her so-called loved ones. Unjustly mistreated by her chauvinistic husband Elmer who runs the local porn theatre and money hungry mother, La Rue, she turns to the bottle for love and support. Life is on the downslide for the Fishpaw household with son Dexter, the reputed neighbourhood phantom foot stomper, daughter Lulu, a crazed pregnant disco groupie and the family dog resorting to suicide. Then, in a Cinderella fantasy, Francine meets her Polyester Prince, Todd Tomorrow (Tab Hunter) and blissfully, they fall in love. Has Francine finally found true meaning to life and happiness or will she return to an unsavoury lifestyle with Elmer, Dexter and Lulu? Co-starring Edith Massey, David Samson, Mary Garlington and Ken King.

results.title: Poltergeist (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Tobe Hooper, Frank Marshall and Steven Spielberg
results.brief_description: Life is very pleasant for a Californian family until a host of other worldly forces invade their peaceful suburban home. There presence is kind of predictable, given that their house is built over a cemetery. The poltergeists takes a particular interest in their 5 year old daughter, who communicates with them through the infamous television scene (a clever about turn on the communication that another alien, ET managed to do in Spielberg’s ‘ET’). Soon their house is turned into a swirling supernatural side show. The forces at work are anything but friendly and if the luckless family doesn’t soon clear out, they’ll all be swept off into a nightmarish chaos. The dark humour of the piece manages to lift Hooper’s (‘Texas chain saw massacre’) scary tale above the horror on the screen. Cast includes Craig T Nelson, Jobeth Williams, Beatrice Straight and Dominique Dunne.

results.title: Police Story 3: Super Cop
results.creator_credit: Stanley Tong, Raymond Chow, Golden Harvest, Golden Way and Leonard Ho
results.brief_description: Jackie Chan is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Tong, Raymond Chow, Golden Harvest, Golden Way and Leonard Ho
results.description: Chan Kong-sang, or as westerners know him, “Jackie Chan”, is the maverick cop Ka Kui who goes undercover to investigate covert arms and drug deals between mainland China and Hong Kong. Michelle Yeoh plays his partner Yeung and together they embark on an action-packed adventure which is full of amazing stunts and daredevil feats that will leave you on the edge of your seat. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Police story = Jingcha gushi [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jackie Chan, Leonard Ho, Golden Harvest and Golden Way
results.brief_description: While Jackie Chan had long been a mega-star in his native Hong Kong for his goofy physical humour and stunt-filled action style, this was the film that made him a household name in the West. A police officer (Chan) is assigned to protect a key witness (Brigitte Lin) in the prosecution of a major drug dealer. On the day of the trial she mysteriously disappears and the drug dealer is set free. The police officer is demoted, but the dealer wants him dead and frames him for the murder of a fellow police officer, forcing him to take the law into his own hands. Full of spectacular stunts and no-holds-barred action sequences, ‘Police Story’ spawned numerous sequels and opened the way for the wider exposure of Hong Kong action cinema to an international audience. Cast also includes Maggie Cheung. In Cantonese with English subtitles.
